bayou.mime

Class ContentType

  • java.lang.Object
    • bayou.mime.ContentType

  • public class ContentType
extends Object
    Content-Type of MIME body.

    A ContentType contains type, subtype, and parameters. The type, subtype, and parameter names are all converted to lower case.

    The Content-Type header is originally defined in RFC2045. This implementation follows RFC2616 §14.17 Content-Type.

    This class is immutable.

      ContentType of "text/plain;charset=UTF-8".
      static ContentType text_html_UTF_8
      ContentType of "text/html;charset=UTF-8".
      static ContentType application_octet_stream
      ContentType of ""application/octet-stream"".

    • Method Detail

      • type

        public String type()
        The type, in lower case.

        CAUTION: This does not include the subtype. For both type and subtype, see types().

      • subtype

        public String subtype()
        The subtype, in lower case.

      • types

        public String types()
        The type and subtype, joined by "/". Example return value: "text/plain". Always in lower case.

      • params

        public Map<String,String> params()
        The parameters as a Map.

        The returned Map is immutable with only lower-case keys.

      • param

        public String param(String name)
        Get the value of the parameter with the name.

        The name should be in lower-case.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        The string form of this ContentType, for example, "text/html;charset=UTF-8".
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • parse

        public static ContentType parse(String contentTypeString)
                         throws IllegalArgumentException
        Parse a string into a ContentType.

        Example input string: "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the input string is not a valid Content-Type value.
